classes.name: BigDecimal
classes.description: Immutable, arbitrary-precision signed decimal numbers. Commonly used in Ignition for precise arithmetic on financial and measurement values where floating-point rounding is unacceptable.

params.name: val
params.description: String representation of the BigDecimal value

constructors.description: Translates the string representation of a BigDecimal into a BigDecimal. This is the preferred constructor for precise values.

params.name: val
params.description: A double value to convert to BigDecimal

constructors.description: Translates a double into a BigDecimal. Note: the result may be unpredictable due to floating-point representation. Prefer the String constructor or valueOf(double).

params.name: val
params.description: String representation of the BigDecimal value

params.name: mc
params.description: The MathContext controlling precision and rounding

constructors.description: Translates the string representation of a BigDecimal into a BigDecimal, with rounding according to the context settings.

params.name: intVal
params.description: The BigInteger value to convert

constructors.description: Translates a BigInteger into a BigDecimal with scale zero.

methods.name: valueOf

params.name: val
params.description: The long value to convert

returns.description: A BigDecimal with the specified long value and scale zero

methods.description: Translates a long value into a BigDecimal with scale zero.

methods.name: valueOf

params.name: unscaledVal
params.description: The unscaled value of the BigDecimal

params.name: scale
params.description: The scale of the BigDecimal

returns.description: A BigDecimal with the specified unscaled value and scale

methods.description: Translates a long unscaled value and an int scale into a BigDecimal.

methods.name: add

params.name: augend
params.description: Value to be added to this BigDecimal

returns.description: this + augend

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is (this + augend).

methods.name: subtract

params.name: subtrahend
params.description: Value to be subtracted from this BigDecimal

returns.description: this - subtrahend

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is (this - subtrahend).

methods.name: multiply

params.name: multiplicand
params.description: Value to be multiplied by this BigDecimal

returns.description: this * multiplicand

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is (this * multiplicand).

methods.name: divide

params.name: divisor
params.description: Value by which this BigDecimal is to be divided

returns.description: this / divisor

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is (this / divisor). Throws ArithmeticException if the result is a non-terminating decimal expansion.

methods.name: divide

params.name: divisor
params.description: Value by which this BigDecimal is to be divided

params.name: scale
params.description: Scale of the resulting BigDecimal

params.name: roundingMode
params.description: Rounding mode to apply (e.g., BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP)

returns.description: this / divisor with specified scale and rounding

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is (this / divisor), with the specified scale and rounding mode applied.

methods.name: divide

params.name: divisor
params.description: Value by which this BigDecimal is to be divided

params.name: roundingMode
params.description: Rounding mode to apply (e.g., BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP)

returns.description: this / divisor with the scale of this and specified rounding

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is (this / divisor), using the scale of this BigDecimal and the specified rounding mode.

methods.name: remainder

params.name: divisor
params.description: Value by which this BigDecimal is to be divided

returns.description: this % divisor

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is (this % divisor).

methods.name: abs

returns.description: The absolute value of this BigDecimal

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is the absolute value of this BigDecimal.

methods.name: negate

returns.description: -this

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is (-this).

methods.name: pow

params.name: n
params.description: Power to raise this BigDecimal to

returns.description: this^n

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose value is (this^n). The power is exact and computed with unlimited precision.

methods.name: compareTo

params.name: val
params.description: BigDecimal to compare with

returns.description: -1 if less, 0 if equal, 1 if greater (ignoring scale)

methods.description: Compares this BigDecimal with the specified BigDecimal. Two BigDecimal objects that are equal in value but have different scales (like 2.0 and 2.00) are considered equal by this method.

methods.name: equals

params.name: x
params.description: Object to compare with

returns.description: True only if both value and scale are equal

methods.description: Compares this BigDecimal with the specified Object for equality. Unlike compareTo, this method considers two BigDecimal objects equal only if they are equal in value and scale (2.0 is not equal to 2.00).

methods.name: min

params.name: val
params.description: Value to compare with

returns.description: The lesser of this and val

methods.description: Returns the minimum of this BigDecimal and val.

methods.name: max

params.name: val
params.description: Value to compare with

returns.description: The greater of this and val

methods.description: Returns the maximum of this BigDecimal and val.

methods.name: scale

returns.description: The scale of this BigDecimal

methods.description: Returns the scale of this BigDecimal. The scale is the number of digits to the right of the decimal point.

methods.name: precision

returns.description: The number of digits in the unscaled value

methods.description: Returns the precision of this BigDecimal, which is the number of digits in the unscaled value.

methods.name: setScale

params.name: newScale
params.description: The scale of the resulting BigDecimal

params.name: roundingMode
params.description: The rounding mode to apply (e.g., BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP)

returns.description: A BigDecimal with the specified scale

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose scale is the specified value, with rounding applied if necessary.

methods.name: setScale

params.name: newScale
params.description: The scale of the resulting BigDecimal

returns.description: A BigDecimal with the specified scale

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal whose scale is the specified value. Throws ArithmeticException if rounding would be required.

methods.name: intValue

returns.description: This BigDecimal converted to an int

methods.description: Converts this BigDecimal to an int, with possible loss of information.

methods.name: longValue

returns.description: This BigDecimal converted to a long

methods.description: Converts this BigDecimal to a long, with possible loss of information.

methods.name: doubleValue

returns.description: This BigDecimal converted to a double

methods.description: Converts this BigDecimal to a double, with possible loss of precision.

methods.name: floatValue

returns.description: This BigDecimal converted to a float

methods.description: Converts this BigDecimal to a float, with possible loss of precision.

methods.name: toBigInteger

returns.description: This BigDecimal converted to a BigInteger

methods.description: Converts this BigDecimal to a BigInteger, discarding the fractional part.

methods.name: toString

returns.description: String representation of this BigDecimal using scientific notation if needed

methods.description: Returns the string representation of this BigDecimal, using scientific notation if an exponent is needed.

methods.name: toPlainString

returns.description: String representation without an exponent field

methods.description: Returns a string representation of this BigDecimal without an exponent field.

methods.name: toEngineeringString

returns.description: String representation using engineering notation if an exponent is needed

methods.description: Returns a string representation of this BigDecimal using engineering notation if an exponent is needed.

methods.name: stripTrailingZeros

returns.description: A numerically equal BigDecimal with trailing zeros removed

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal which is numerically equal to this one but with any trailing zeros removed from the representation.

methods.name: movePointLeft

params.name: n
params.description: Number of places to move the decimal point to the left

returns.description: A BigDecimal with the decimal point moved n places to the left

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal equivalent to this one with the decimal point moved n places to the left.

methods.name: movePointRight

params.name: n
params.description: Number of places to move the decimal point to the right

returns.description: A BigDecimal with the decimal point moved n places to the right

methods.description: Returns a BigDecimal equivalent to this one with the decimal point moved n places to the right.

methods.name: signum

returns.description: -1 if negative, 0 if zero, 1 if positive

methods.description: Returns the signum function of this BigDecimal.

methods.name: unscaledValue

returns.description: The unscaled value of this BigDecimal

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is the unscaled value of this BigDecimal.

fields.name: ZERO
fields.description: The value 0, with a scale of 0.

fields.name: ONE
fields.description: The value 1, with a scale of 0.

fields.name: TEN
fields.description: The value 10, with a scale of 0.

fields.name: ROUND_UP
fields.description: Rounding mode to round away from zero. Always increments the digit prior to a nonzero discarded fraction.

fields.name: ROUND_DOWN
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards zero. Never increments the digit prior to a discarded fraction.

fields.name: ROUND_CEILING
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards positive infinity.

fields.name: ROUND_FLOOR
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards negative infinity.

fields.name: ROUND_HALF_UP
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards the nearest neighbor, rounding up if equidistant. This is the most common rounding mode.

fields.name: ROUND_HALF_DOWN
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards the nearest neighbor, rounding down if equidistant.

fields.name: ROUND_HALF_EVEN
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards the nearest neighbor, rounding to even if equidistant (banker's rounding).

fields.name: ROUND_UNNECESSARY
fields.description: Rounding mode to assert that the operation has an exact result, hence no rounding is necessary. Throws ArithmeticException if rounding would be required.

classes.name: BigInteger
classes.description: Immutable arbitrary-precision integers. Provides analogues to all of Java's primitive integer operators and all relevant methods from java.lang.Math.

params.name: val
params.description: Decimal string representation of the BigInteger

constructors.description: Translates the decimal string representation of a BigInteger into a BigInteger.

params.name: val
params.description: String representation of the BigInteger in the specified radix

params.name: radix
params.description: Radix to use for interpreting val

constructors.description: Translates the string representation of a BigInteger in the specified radix into a BigInteger.

params.name: signum
params.description: Signum of the number (-1 for negative, 0 for zero, 1 for positive)

params.name: magnitude
params.description: Big-endian magnitude of the number

constructors.description: Translates the sign-magnitude representation of a BigInteger into a BigInteger.

methods.name: valueOf

params.name: val
params.description: The long value to convert

returns.description: A BigInteger with the specified value

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is equal to that of the specified long.

methods.name: probablePrime

params.name: bitLength
params.description: Bit length of the returned BigInteger

params.name: rnd
params.description: Source of random bits for selecting a candidate prime

returns.description: A positive BigInteger that is probably prime

methods.description: Returns a positive BigInteger that is probably prime, with the specified bitLength.

methods.name: add

params.name: val
params.description: Value to be added to this BigInteger

returns.description: this + val

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this + val).

methods.name: subtract

params.name: val
params.description: Value to be subtracted from this BigInteger

returns.description: this - val

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this - val).

methods.name: multiply

params.name: val
params.description: Value to be multiplied by this BigInteger

returns.description: this * val

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this * val).

methods.name: divide

params.name: val
params.description: Value by which this BigInteger is to be divided

returns.description: this / val (integer division)

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this / val). Uses integer division that truncates towards zero.

methods.name: remainder

params.name: val
params.description: Value by which this BigInteger is to be divided

returns.description: this % val

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this % val).

methods.name: mod

params.name: m
params.description: The modulus, which must be positive

returns.description: this mod m

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this mod m). This method differs from remainder in that it always returns a non-negative BigInteger.

methods.name: pow

params.name: exponent
params.description: Exponent to which this BigInteger is to be raised

returns.description: this^exponent

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this^exponent). The exponent must be non-negative.

methods.name: abs

returns.description: The absolute value of this BigInteger

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is the absolute value of this BigInteger.

methods.name: negate

returns.description: -this

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (-this).

methods.name: compareTo

params.name: val
params.description: BigInteger to compare with

returns.description: -1 if less, 0 if equal, 1 if greater

methods.description: Compares this BigInteger with the specified BigInteger.

methods.name: equals

params.name: x
params.description: Object to compare with

returns.description: True if the object is a BigInteger with the same value

methods.description: Compares this BigInteger with the specified Object for equality.

methods.name: min

params.name: val
params.description: Value to compare with

returns.description: The lesser of this and val

methods.description: Returns the minimum of this BigInteger and val.

methods.name: max

params.name: val
params.description: Value to compare with

returns.description: The greater of this and val

methods.description: Returns the maximum of this BigInteger and val.

methods.name: intValue

returns.description: This BigInteger converted to an int

methods.description: Converts this BigInteger to an int, with possible loss of information.

methods.name: longValue

returns.description: This BigInteger converted to a long

methods.description: Converts this BigInteger to a long, with possible loss of information.

methods.name: doubleValue

returns.description: This BigInteger converted to a double

methods.description: Converts this BigInteger to a double, with possible loss of precision.

methods.name: floatValue

returns.description: This BigInteger converted to a float

methods.description: Converts this BigInteger to a float, with possible loss of precision.

methods.name: toString

returns.description: Decimal string representation of this BigInteger

methods.description: Returns the decimal string representation of this BigInteger.

methods.name: toString

params.name: radix
params.description: Radix of the string representation

returns.description: String representation in the specified radix

methods.description: Returns the string representation of this BigInteger in the given radix.

methods.name: bitLength

returns.description: Number of bits in the minimal two's-complement representation, excluding the sign bit

methods.description: Returns the number of bits in the minimal two's-complement representation of this BigInteger, excluding a sign bit.

methods.name: bitCount

returns.description: Number of bits that differ from the sign bit

methods.description: Returns the number of bits in the two's complement representation of this BigInteger that differ from its sign bit.

methods.name: signum

returns.description: -1 if negative, 0 if zero, 1 if positive

methods.description: Returns the signum function of this BigInteger.

methods.name: gcd

params.name: val
params.description: Value with which the GCD is to be computed

returns.description: The greatest common divisor of abs(this) and abs(val)

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is the greatest common divisor of abs(this) and abs(val).

methods.name: isProbablePrime

params.name: certainty
params.description: A measure of the uncertainty that the caller is willing to tolerate

returns.description: True if this BigInteger is probably prime, false if it is definitely composite

methods.description: Returns true if this BigInteger is probably prime, false if it is definitely composite. The certainty parameter is a measure of the uncertainty; the probability of a false positive is at most (1/2)^certainty.

methods.name: and

params.name: val
params.description: Value to AND with this BigInteger

returns.description: this & val

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this & val). Returns a negative BigInteger if and only if this and val are both negative.

methods.name: or

params.name: val
params.description: Value to OR with this BigInteger

returns.description: this | val

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this | val). Returns a negative BigInteger if and only if either this or val is negative.

methods.name: xor

params.name: val
params.description: Value to XOR with this BigInteger

returns.description: this ^ val

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this ^ val). Returns a negative BigInteger if and only if exactly one of this and val is negative.

methods.name: not

returns.description: ~this

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (~this), the bitwise complement.

methods.name: shiftLeft

params.name: n
params.description: Shift distance, in bits

returns.description: this << n

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this << n). Computes floor(this * 2^n).

methods.name: shiftRight

params.name: n
params.description: Shift distance, in bits

returns.description: this >> n

methods.description: Returns a BigInteger whose value is (this >> n). Computes floor(this / 2^n).

methods.name: toByteArray

returns.description: A byte array containing the two's-complement representation

methods.description: Returns a byte array containing the two's-complement representation of this BigInteger in big-endian byte order.

fields.name: ZERO
fields.description: The BigInteger constant zero.

fields.name: ONE
fields.description: The BigInteger constant one.

fields.name: TEN
fields.description: The BigInteger constant ten.

classes.name: MathContext
classes.description: Immutable objects which encapsulate the context settings that describe certain rules for numerical operators, such as precision and rounding mode.

params.name: precision
params.description: The non-negative int precision setting

constructors.description: Constructs a new MathContext with the specified precision and the HALF_UP rounding mode.

params.name: precision
params.description: The non-negative int precision setting

params.name: roundingMode
params.description: The rounding mode to use

constructors.description: Constructs a new MathContext with the specified precision and rounding mode.

methods.name: getPrecision

returns.description: The precision setting (0 indicates unlimited precision)

methods.description: Returns the precision setting. A value of 0 indicates unlimited precision.

methods.name: getRoundingMode

returns.description: The rounding mode setting

methods.description: Returns the RoundingMode setting.

methods.name: equals

params.name: x
params.description: Object to compare with

returns.description: True if the specified object is a MathContext with the same settings

methods.description: Compares this MathContext with the specified Object for equality.

methods.name: toString

returns.description: A string representation of this MathContext

methods.description: Returns the string representation of this MathContext.

fields.name: UNLIMITED
fields.description: A MathContext with unlimited precision and HALF_UP rounding mode.

fields.name: DECIMAL32
fields.description: A MathContext with precision of 7 digits and HALF_EVEN rounding mode, matching IEEE 754R Decimal32 format.

fields.name: DECIMAL64
fields.description: A MathContext with precision of 16 digits and HALF_EVEN rounding mode, matching IEEE 754R Decimal64 format.

fields.name: DECIMAL128
fields.description: A MathContext with precision of 34 digits and HALF_EVEN rounding mode, matching IEEE 754R Decimal128 format.

classes.name: RoundingMode
classes.description: Specifies a rounding behavior for numerical operations capable of discarding precision. Each rounding mode indicates how the least significant returned digit of a rounded result is to be calculated.

methods.name: valueOf

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the rounding mode constant (e.g., "HALF_UP")

returns.description: The RoundingMode constant with the specified name

methods.description: Returns the RoundingMode constant with the specified name.

methods.name: values

returns.description: An array containing all RoundingMode constants

methods.description: Returns an array containing all RoundingMode constants in the order they are declared.

fields.name: UP
fields.description: Rounding mode to round away from zero. Always increments the digit prior to a nonzero discarded fraction.

fields.name: DOWN
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards zero. Never increments the digit prior to a discarded fraction (truncates).

fields.name: CEILING
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards positive infinity. If positive, behaves as UP; if negative, behaves as DOWN.

fields.name: FLOOR
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards negative infinity. If positive, behaves as DOWN; if negative, behaves as UP.

fields.name: HALF_UP
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards nearest neighbor, rounding up if equidistant. This is the most commonly used rounding mode.

fields.name: HALF_DOWN
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards nearest neighbor, rounding down if equidistant.

fields.name: HALF_EVEN
fields.description: Rounding mode to round towards nearest neighbor, rounding to even neighbor if equidistant (banker's rounding). Minimizes cumulative error over many calculations.

fields.name: UNNECESSARY
fields.description: Rounding mode to assert that the operation has an exact result, hence no rounding is necessary. Throws ArithmeticException if rounding would be required.
